CreditLine: Acquired by William T. or, more likely, Henry Walters, before 1901
Description:
The silver-pierced frame-like rim of this miniature, set with brilliants, likely post-dates the portrait, which may be after a 1780s painting by William Hamilton of Mrs. Siddons (1755-1831) in the role of as Euphrasia from "The Grecian Daughter" by Arthur Murphy. In this painting Siddons is shown almost in profile with an up-turned gaze. Better known as Mrs. Siddons, she was a great tragic actress, best known for her portrayal of Lady Macbeth.
The back of the miniature contains a piece of hair and a monogram in seed pearl, "H.S." or possibly "H.C.S.."
Inscriptions: [Initials] On back: H.S. or possibly H.C.S.
Provenance: William T. or, more likely, Henry Walters, Baltimore, before 1901 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Mrs. Siddons (?)
